item_blurb: Public comments will be heard at 9:00am for items not on the agenda, for no more than 30 minutes. For those unable to attend the early comment period, there may be additional comment time available later in the day. Note: Comments made during the general public comment period regarding matters pending before the Commission do not become part of the official record for those matters.

subitem_title: Executive Director's Report
Commission Correspondence
subitem_blurb: Consideration and potential action on Commission correspondence.

subitem_title: Legislative Report
subitem_blurb: Review, discussion and possible action on pending legislation. (JA/SC-SF)

subitem_title: CCC/BCDC/SCC Interagency Agreement
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and California Coastal Commission (CCC) authorization to enter into Interagency Agreements with San Francisco Bay Conservation and Development Commission (BCDC) and the State Coastal Conservancy (SCC). Approval of the transfer of federal funds to BCDC and SCC for implementation of the California Coastal Management Program for Fiscal Year 2017-2018. (SH/MJ-SF)

subitem_title: CCC/SLC Interagency Agreement
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and California Coastal Commission (CCC) authorization to enter into Interagency Agreement with State Lands Commission (SLC) to support SLC’s staff costs for participation in CCC’s federal funded project to develop policy guidance and memorandum of agreement to manage public trust resources in light of sea level rise. (MJ/MC-SF)

subitem_title: LCP Grant
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and possible Commission action on recommended grant awards for Round 4 of the Commission's LCP Grant Program. (MC-SF)

subitem_title: Public Trust
subitem_blurb: Presentation by Center for Ocean Solutions on consensus statement from law and policy experts on the Public Trust Doctrine, sea level rise, and coastal land use in California.

subitem_title: Draft Residential Adaptation Policy Guidance
subitem_blurb: Presentation on Draft Residential Adaptation Policy Guidance for consideration and future Commission adoption. (MM/MC-SF) Discussion only.

subitem_title: Application No. 5-16-1130 (Ouzounian, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Brian Ouzounian to remove 396 sq.ft. dock float and replace with 482 sq.ft. dock float, at 1222 E. Balboa Blvd., Newport Beach, Orange County. (FSY-LB)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-17-0526 (Sheehy, Newport Beach)
subitem_blurb: Application of Bryan Sheehy to construct 14' x 10' pier and replace 1,080 sq.ft. F-shaped dock float with new 1,138 sq.ft. F-shaped dock float re-using headwalk and one existing dock finger; remove and replace seven 10-in. round steel pipe piles, and install new 24' x 5' gangway, at 2495 Ocean Blvd., Corona del Mar, City of Newport Beach, Orange County. (DN-SF)

subitem_title: Application No. 5-17-0167 (City of Seal Beach Pier Enhancement Project)
subitem_blurb: Application of City of Seal Beach to upgrade utility lines on municipal pier (including water, sewer, gas and electrical lines), and make structural repairs (to cracked concrete encasements, broken piles, handrails, stringers, braces, and some timber decking) in Seal Beach, Orange County. (MR-LB)

item_title: Deputy Director's Report for Orange County
item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, LCP matters not requiring public hearings, and on comments from the public.  For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: City of Newport Beach LCP Amendment No. 2-17 (LCP-5-NPB-17-0047-1) (191 Riverside Avenue)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by the City of Newport Beach to change the LCP land use designation from Public Facilities (PF) to Mixed Use Horizontal (MU-H1) and zoning designation from Public Facilities (PF) to Mixed-Use Mariners Mile (MU-MM) for the property located at 191 Riverside Avenue, Newport Beach, Orange County. (LR-LB)

subitem_status: Substantial Issue Found, de Novo Hearing Postponed

subitem_status: Substantial Issue Found, de Novo Hearing Continued

(MA-LB)

subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, Approved with Conditions

subitem_title: Permit No. A-5-LGB-14-0034-A1 (Laguna Beach Golf and Bungalow Village, LLC, Laguna Beach)
subitem_blurb: Request by Laguna Beach Golf and Bungalow Village, LLC to amend special condition 13 regarding Tree Trimming and Tree Removal Policy and 1) restoration of areas of Aliso Creek impacted by unauthorized trimming; 2) establishment of low-growing riparian plant palette in areas of Aliso Creek to avoid future maintenance/disturbance in Creek; and 3) implementation of restoration plan to mitigate impacts of previous tree trimming/vegetation removal activities in Aliso Creek and removal of downed vegetation from streambank due to January 2017 seasonal storm, at 31106 Coast Hwy., Laguna Beach, Orange County. (LR-LB)

item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, LCP matters not requiring public hearings, and on comments from the public.  For specific information contact the Commission's San Diego office at (619) 767-2370.

subitem_title: City of Carlsbad LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-CII-17-0031-3 (Poinsettia 61)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by City of Carlsbad to redesignate land uses on seven parcels located south of Cassia Road, between the existing western and eastern segments of Poinsettia Lane, and east of Ambrosia Lane, from R-4 and Open Space (OS) to R-8 and OS, and then rezone the parcels from One Family Residential (R-1) and OS to Residential Density Multiple (RD-M) and OS. (EP-SD)

subitem_title: City of Carlsbad LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-CAR-17-0032-4 (Cannon Road Agriculture/Open Space Zone)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on request by City of Carlsbad to amend its certified land use plan and implementation plan to add a new Cannon Road Agriculture/Open Space Zone (CR-A/OS) to implement Proposition D on two properties in Planning Area 8 located south of Cannon Road within the Carlsbad Ranch Specific Plan area. (EP-SD)

subitem_title: City of Del Mar LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-DMR-16-0073-1 (Parking Regulations) Certification Review
subitem_blurb: Concurrence with Executive Director’s determination that the action by City of Del Mar, accepting the Commission’s certification of LCP-6-DMR-16-0073-1 with modifications, is legally adequate. (SR-SD)

subitem_title: City of San Diego LCP Amendment No. LCP-6-SAN-17-0050-2 (Retail Sales/Marijuana Outlets) Time Extension
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the 60 day time limit for Commission action up to one year on request by City of San Diego to amend its certified Implementation Plan to add a new retail sales use for marijuana outlets. (DNL-SD)

(ML-SD)

(KC-SD)

(AL-SD)
subitem_status: Moved to Consent Calendar, Approved with Conditions

subitem_title: Application No. 9-15-1931 (Coast Seafoods, Arcata)

subitem_title: County of Los Angeles Santa Monica Mountains LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-MMT-17-0038-1
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on the County of Los Angeles’ request to amend the Land Use Plan (LUP) and Local Implementation Plan (LIP) portions of its certified Santa Monica Mountains Local Coastal Program (LCP) to change the land use and zoning designations for 95 parcels; to reflect 61 parcels acquired by park agencies since certification that will be designated for Open Space and 34 privately owned parcels that will be redesignated from Open Space to residential or coastal recreation; minor mapping corrections; and text amendments to clarify various LUP polices and LIP provisions regarding biological resources, standards related to other Los Angeles County agencies, recreation, and scenic resources, Los Angeles County. (WH-V)

subitem_title: County of Santa Barbara LCP Amendment No. LCP-4-STB-17-0048-1 (Eastern Goleta Valley Community Plan)
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action on the County of Santa Barbara’s request to amend portions of the certified LCP, including to amend the text and maps of the Land Use Plan to adopt the Eastern Goleta Valley Community Plan and to amend the zoning ordinance to adopt new regulations to implement the Eastern Goleta Valley Community Plan. (MS-V)

item_title: Deputy Director's Report for Los Angeles County
item_blurb: Report by Deputy Director on permit waivers, emergency permits, immaterial amendments & extensions, LCP matters not requiring public hearings, and on comments from the public.  For specific information contact the Commission's Long Beach office at (562) 590-5071.

subitem_title: City of Manhattan Beach LCP Amendment No. 1-17 (LCP-5-MNB-17-0024-1) Downtown Specific Plan
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the time limit for Commission action for up to one year on request by the City of Manhattan Beach to amend the Land Use Plan (LUP) and Implementing Ordinances (IP) portions of the certified LCP in order to implement changes adopted as part of the City’s proposed Downtown Specific Plan. The LCP amendment would also change the LUP Map and IP Chapter A.16.030(g) to reconcile designation nomenclature and map inconsistencies. (MR-LB)

subitem_title: City of Redondo Beach LCP Amendment No. 1-17 (LCP-5-RDB-17-0045-1) Measure C
subitem_blurb: Public hearing and action to extend the time limit for Commission action for up to one year on request by the City of Redondo Beach to amend the LCP Implementing Ordinances (IP) portions of the certified LCP to incorporate changes included in voter-sponsored Initiative Measure C, known as the “King Harbor Coastal Access, Revitalization, and Enhancement Act.” (CP-LB)

(SV-LB)
subitem_status: Substantial Issue Found, de Novo Hearing Continued

(SV-LB)
